entry.title: Intro
entry.content:
The tabular form is most commonly used to represent data for analysis . Each row indicates a data point representing a single observation, and each column shows a dimension describing the data point.

Dimensions are also known as variables, attributes or features.

Variable Types

There are four main types of dimensions, and it is important to distinguish between them to ensure that they are appropriate for our selected algorithms.

Binary. This is the simplest type of variable, with only two possible options. In Table 1, a binary variable is used to indicate if customers bought fish.

Categorical. When there are more than two options, the information can be represented via a categorical variable. In Table 1, a categorical variable is used to describe the customersâ€™ species. Integer. These are used when the information can be represented as a whole number. In Table 1, an integer variable is used to indicate the number of fruits purchased by each customer.

Continuous. This is the most detailed variable, representing numbers with decimal places. In Table 1, a continuous variable is used to indicate the amount spent by each customer.

entry.title: DAT203.1x Module 3 Lesson 1
entry.content:
Things covered today:

  • 2 main topics in this module: DAT203x (AML) and DAT209x (R Programming)

  • DAT203x (all answers on Ryan’s website)

    • Lab 1 to Lab 6 = 60% overall course + Final Challenge
    • 2 types of models: Classification and Regression
    • Lab 1: Classification on Credit Scoring
    • Lab 2: Summary statistics, Regression on Automobile price data
    • Lab 3: Simulation. Predict profitability of ice cream sales.

  • DAT209x

    • No final exams, only labs.

  • Project is on AML

    • Data: Flight delay dataset, >2M rows
    • Task: Create regression to predict flight delay, Publish as web service

  • Go through Azure Machine Learning modules:

    • Datasets
    • Run History
    • Jupyter Notebook (must convert output to csv first)
      • Why use Jupyter? When dataset is big, it takes a long time to process in AML
      • Alternative is to use Rmarkdown

  • Homework:

    • Experiment in Module 2 - convert it into Azure ML
    • Lab 1 - 3 for DAT203x before first mentoring session with Kishan
